entry.title: Ensure Windows System Proxy Resolver sandbox calls LowerToken()
entry.content:
The code for this sandbox followed the patterns established by the Media

Foundation CDM sandbox, but a mistake was made where the former sandbox

followed the the latter in skipping a call to

`TargetServices::LowerToken()`, which drops higher privileges from the

new sandboxed process. The CDM sandbox can do this because it calls

`LowerToken()` later on, but that isn't the case for the proxy

resolution sandbox.



This change addresses the problem by removing the exclusion for the

proxy sandbox in the standard place where sandboxed processes call

`TargetServices::LowerToken()`. It also separates out the proxy sandbox

in one other location where it is bundled a little too closely with the

CDM sandbox, which could lead to another similar class of problem in the

future.



Bug: 1032820

Change-Id: I6ff541b893e2ee31feed090a8b17479a657eaf69

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4647953

Reviewed-by: Alex Gough

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Commit-Queue: Nicolas Arciniega

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1168439}

entry.title: shortcuts: Add aria-label for accelerator-view
entry.content:
Problem:

Aria-label is missing for accelerator-view, in tast-test we can't

verify the shortcut exists by selecting the shortcut key-combination.



Reason:

The tab order was updated, removing accelerator-view from the tab

sequence.(tab order now: row -> edit-button -> next row).



As a result, if having multiple accelerators, it will be combined

together(http://screen/4UjHQ8XzoCic8AC)

We can't select the element like before using `nodewith.Name("alt shift s").Role(role.Cell)`



Fix:

Add an aria-label for accelerator-view, then select the element using

`nodewith.Name("alt shift s").Role(role.GenericContainer)`



Screenshot:

Before: http://screen/4UjHQ8XzoCic8AC

After: http://screen/tjG5mk93gCrtKBS



Bug: b/216049298

Test: browser_tests --gtest_filter=ShortcutCustomizationApp*

Change-Id: I95fa4482e281cea47199fb7d59400bea7fd1c6f9

entry.title: RELAND: media/gpu/v4l2: configure V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder CAPTURE queue
entry.content:
This CL continues implementing V4L2StatefulVideoDecoder, concretely the

configuration and pre-filling of the |CAPTURE_queue_| (which will hold

decoded video pictures).



It basically follows the V4L2 spec plus the necessary interactions with

VideoDecoderPipeline:

- InitializeCAPTUREQueue() creates |CAPTURE_queue_| and queries some

info, e.g. codec size, visible rect, or number of desired reference

frames for the given codec (this latter number has some sanitization

so it's done in a new method GetNumberOfReferenceFrames()).

- InitializeCAPTUREQueue() then enumerates all |CAPTURE_queue_| possible

pixel formats and asks its |client_| (VideoDecoderPipeline) to

PickDecoderOutputFormat(). VDPipeline then figures out if any candidate

is preferred and if it needs an ImageProcessor to adapt formats (mt8173)

or not (qualcomm).

- InitializeCAPTUREQueue() finally tells |CAPTURE_queue_| to Allocate()

a number of buffers; the allocation, and the type of buffer, depends on

whether |CAPTURE_queue_| has to feed the whole Media pipeline, or just

VDPipeline's ImageProcessor (see |use_v4l2_allocated_buffers|).



With this, both queues are initialized and ready to go. Next CLs will

start grabbing decoded picture frames out of |CAPTURE_queue_| and

sending them to |client_|, etc.



Tested on hana and trogdor via:

/usr/local/libexec/chrome-binary-tests/video_decode_accelerator_tests /usr/local/share/tast/data_pushed/go.chromium.org/tast-tests/cros/local/bundles/cros/video/data/test-25fps.vp8 '--vmodule=*/media/gpu/v4l2/*=4' --gtest_filter=*.Decode:*.FlushAtEndOfStream --enable-features=V4L2FlatStatefulVideoDecoder



Bug: b:279980150

Change-Id: Ib8b80b257d488aed1ab059a55bb4cfb48215c292

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4675677

Reviewed-by: Hang Nguyen

Commit-Queue: Miguel Casas-Sanchez

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1168433}

entry.title: Move popover invoker CHECK
entry.content:
I added this CHECK in http://crrev.com/1166594 but it will get hit when

showPopover is called while the popover is open with an invoker. This

patch moves the CHECK down past the IsPopoverReady check to avoid

getting hit. If the popover is already open, then the IsPopoverReady

check will return before the CHECK is run.



The motivation behind the CHECK is still fine - it ensures that while

the popover is closed, it can't have an invoker set.



Fixed: 1463384

Change-Id: Ie75a1026acefd9ce8018caf96b2bb314a18ac730

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4676654

Commit-Queue: Mason Freed

Auto-Submit: Joey Arhar

Reviewed-by: Mason Freed

Commit-Queue: Joey Arhar

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1168432}

entry.title: Remove a reachable NOTREACHED() in formStateRestoreCallback
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/4541642 assumed that ElementInternals cannot have a null

value and a non-null state at the same time, and added a NOTREACHED()

for that situation, which is wrong. However, it still handles the case

correctly in production builds where the NOTREACHED() is ignored.



So this patch simply removes the NOTREACHED() and adds a test case.



Fixed: 1462111

Change-Id: Ie0d9e06223245d10378bcfa5e7d1a30eb7841a14

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4676136

entry.title: [FedCM] Fix contrast ratio issue for IDP branding
entry.content:
We use a minimum contrast ratio to make sure the branding button color

sufficiently contrasts with the dialog background. However, we are using

`kMinimumReadableContrastRatio` which is to make sure that the text is

readable. In fact, we should use `kMinimumVisibleContrastRatio` which is

to make sure that users can "see it but don't have to read fine detail".

entry.title: Reject when `navigator.storage.estimate()` fails to calculate usage
entry.content:
Previously an error in retrieving buckets would return a usage of -1

(which is later converted to an unsigned integer, so is reported as

2^64). This changes QuotaManagerImpl logic to report an error which

ultimately causes the promise to reject.



This also changes the type of the rejection to be a TypeError instead of

a DOMException to match the spec:

https://storage.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-storagemanager-estimate



Bug: 1451614

entry.title: Add feature to merge subprocess metrics asynchronously
entry.content:
The feature, when enabled, allows enabling certain async behaviours

through params:

- The "PeriodicMergeAsync" param makes merging subprocess metrics for

periodic ongoing logs asynchronously.

(See SubprocessMetricsProvider::MergeHistogramDeltas()).

- The "DeregisterAsync" param makes merging the metrics of exiting

subproccesses asynchronously.

(See SubprocessMetricsProvider::DeregisterSubprocessAllocator()).

- The "DeregisterSequenced" param determines whether the tasks

for this are sequenced.



This (unfortunately?) uses refcounting. However, since the reference

counts are only modified on the same sequence (main thread), this uses

RefCounted (and not ThreadSafeRefCounted). Initially, I manually kept

track of a count of how many background tasks were pending to detect

when to release the allocators, but the code was pretty much just me

implementing my own refcounting, so I just used RefCounted instead

(which simplified the implementation a lot).



In terms of thread safety, this should be fine to do. In particular,

the background tasks will iterate through shared memory segments to

find histograms. It will snapshot them (which was made threadsafe

in a previous CL through atomics and locks: crrev.com/c/4346077),

and then merge them with the SR histograms (which should be threadsafe

since it is pretty much equivalent to just emitting a histogram).





Bug: 1293026,1271971

Change-Id: I52d39d412f12bf329b0af196eb180df845facd34

entry.title: Revert "[Local Network Access] Rename net log event from private to local"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 0e5a66bc88f07d6900b5e3d346d5eb9a5b8a76ae.



Reason for revert: The spec has been renamed back to Private Network Access https://github.com/WICG/private-network-access/pull/106



Original change's description:

> [Local Network Access] Rename net log event from private to local

>

> In https://github.com/WICG/local-network-access/issues/91, we decided to

> rename Private Network Access to Local Network Access. The spec has

> already been renamed in

> https://github.com/WICG/local-network-access/pull/97. The latest spec:

> https://wicg.github.io/local-network-access/

>

> This CL renames PrivateNetwork to LocalNetwork in net log events.

>

> There are so many places to rename, so during the process, there will

> inevitably be inconsistencies. Hopefully, we shall resolve all of them

> soon.

>

entry.title: Fix histograms.xml for SharedDictionary related UMAs
entry.content:
MetadataReadTime UMAs are recorded with

"Net.SharedDictionaryStorageOnDisk" prefix. But in histogram.xml, they

are registered with "Net.SharedDictionaryStore" prefix.



This CL fixes histogram.xml to show those UMAs in the analysis site.



OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Net.SharedDictionaryStore.MetadataReadTime.Empty]=Not used.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Net.SharedDictionaryStore.MetadataReadTime.Failure]=Not used.

OBSOLETE_HISTOGRAM[Net.SharedDictionaryStore.MetadataReadTime.NonEmpty]=Not used.

The broadcast receiver registration type is changed to fit the usage better, as noted in documentation here: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:base/android/java/src/org/chromium/base/ContextUtils.java;l=291



If required in the future, it can be changed to exported but will require permissions. This is a follow up to: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4251540 for preserving the original logic of tab sharing.

entry.title: [omnibox] Instantiate presenter with webui omnibox popup view, etc.
entry.content:
This CL does 3 things: expands lifetime, holds open for devtools, and

significantly upgrades testability of the webui omnibox popup view.



First, it expands the lifetime of OmniboxPopupPresenter to that of the

owning OmniboxPopupViewWebUI instead of instantiating on demand during

updates. This fixes an issue where initial input and suggestions were

not shown by the popup.



Additionally, this CL considers the devtools status before closing the

popup so the native view can be inspected. See for more context:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4643132/comments/ac88c013_90e2aa58



Finally, this CL makes it possible to cleanly test the webui omnibox

popup view by first waiting for the webui handler to become available

and bound by the remote. Before this blocking mechanism was

implemented, there were various failure modes relating to the webui

handler, particularly absence before navigation, and then even when

it was present, calls could be made before the remote was bound, which

would also cause crashes. Now it reliably navigates, binds, and works!



Bug: 1458266, 1396174

entry.title: bento_button: Add focus support to the new desk bar
entry.content:
This change adds focus support to the new desk bar. The new bar will use

the default focus manager from the view tree, while the overview bar

will continue to use a customized overview highlight controller.



Please note that this change introduces the following differences in bar

behaviors:

- When tabbing in the desk name view, the overview bar only highlights

the view, but does not focus. The new bar will focus directly.

- When committing a name change for the desk name view, the overview

bar uses a cached highlighted view to re-claim focus to re-edit. The

new bar does not support this.

entry.title: ReportConfiguration Create refactoring
entry.content:
This is a readability improvement.

Using this pattern, `ReportConfiguration::Create` can mostly be called

with one parameter only - Settings. The actual parameters then appear with their names, and we can skip some that are defaults. C++ allows to change their order as well, but Lint does not accept that.



Unfortunately, non-trivial parameters (callbacks, smart pointers)

do not compile if added to Settings. To overcome this limitation,

I made `ReportConfiguration::Create` return Builder instance, that

has setters for those parameters too. Once everything is set, `Build`

method needs to be called to produce `StatusOr`.



Legacy `ReportConfiguration::Create` is preserved too, so no

backwards compatibility issues should surface.



Bug: None

entry.title: [Auto-disable Accessibility] Add a ConfigurationUtils class
entry.content:
This CL continues work on consolidating all accessibility state code

in Clank to a single source of truth.



With this CL we create a ConfigurationUtils class and move a method

of AccessibilityUtils to this new class.



Users may be attaching external keyboards for accessibility purposes,

and so adding this to AccessibilityState may seem like a natural step,

but the Configuration does not behave like the system accessibility

properties. To check the keyboard status we need to fetch it from the

Context's Resources.



There is not a clean way to add the static AccessibilityState class

as an Observer of the Activity's onConfigurationChange. So the current

state stored in AccessibilityState may become stale unless we add a

public method and allow a Configuration observer in the //chrome/

layer to drive those updates (e.g. AsyncInitializationActivity,

ActivityLifecycleDispatcherImpl, etc). Alternatively we could use a

similar approach as AccessibilityUtil and add a dependency in

AccessibilityState on content.res.Configuration, and require all

callers to pass a Configuration or fetch it in AccessibilityState.

Since both cases would be fetching the Configuration from ContextUtils's

ApplicationContext, it seems cleaner to do that in one place and allow

all interested clients to simply call:



ConfigurationUtils.isHardwareKeyboardAttached().



AX-Relnotes: N/A

Bug: 1430202, b/265493191

entry.content:
This CL schedules a repaint on the desk button after the background is

changed. Previously, we were not doing this, and so occasionally only

the label background would repaint, meaning the backgrounds behind the

desk switch buttons would not repaint. We fix this by repainting the

full button after changing the background.

entry.title: Don't paint background into scrolling contents if there is border image
entry.content:
A border image can have insets padding box. Painting background into

scrolling contents caused the background to cover the inset part of

the border image.



We could check if a border image really has inset, but as border

images on scrollers are rare based on ClusterTelemetry analysis using

crrev.com/c/4667579/:

- Desktop 10k: https://ct.skia.org/results/cluster-telemetry/tasks/benchmark_runs/wangxianzhu-ChromiumAnalysis-6163/consolidated_outputs/wangxianzhu-ChromiumAnalysis-6163.output

0 of 10k sites have border images on scrollers.

- Mobile 10k: https://ct.skia.org/results/cluster-telemetry/tasks/benchmark_runs/wangxianzhu-ChromiumAnalysis-6162/consolidated_outputs/wangxianzhu-ChromiumAnalysis-6162.output

Only 1 of 10k sites have border images on scrollers.



Bug: 1426649

Change-Id: I5e39085340c4750daef1792ad98cecddace8d2c5

entry.title: [iOS] Unconditionally set promos manager in SceneController
entry.content:
This CL removes the check for IsDefaultBrowserInPromoManagerEnabled()

to set unconditionally defaultBrowserAgent.promosManager, since the PostRestoreDefaultBrowserAlert promo relies on

defaultBrowserAgent.promosManager always being set.



This CL does not change the functionality of any other default browser

promo, as there is still a check for

IsDefaultBrowserInPromoManagerEnabled() in

the DefaultBrowserSceneAgent before registering other default

browser promos with the promos manager.

entry.title: Fix incorrect color interpretation in LocalPrinterAsh::CreatePrintJob()
entry.content:
In CreatePrintJob(), the result of the IsColorModelSelected() call is an

optional. The interpretation of the result currently looks at

whether the optional has a value, which means the print job is always

set to color mode. Instead, CreatePrintJob() should look at the actual

bool value to determine whether the job is in color or not.



Add a CHECK() on the LaCros side to make sure the Ash call to

IsColorModelSelected() will always succeed.

entry.title: media/gpu/vaapi/test: Prefer DVLOG() over LOG(INFO)
entry.content:
In theory LOG(ERROR/WARNING/INFO) and VLOG(1..) are basically the

same thing with different levels (INFO would correspond to 0,

WARNING to -1 etc).



But ChromeOS Ash has a use_runtime_vlog BUILD.gn flag that is not

defined for non-developer builds, which forces binaries (like the one

in this CL) to ignore command line "-v" and "--vmodule" flags, using

instead a default level of 0; this means _all_ LOG()s are dumped to

stdout, and the binary ignores "-v" and "--vmodule".



This super sad situation should be fixed by making test/dev

binaries (at least) respect those flags. Sadly, nobody knows the

extent of this change (crrev.com/c/4669946), so instead I'm forced

to get back to the binary that turned out to be too verbose and

fix the logging instead, to comply with //media recommendations [1]



With that, this CL basically flips per-frame LOG(INFO)s to

DVLOG(3)s; the places to investigate come from the query:



$ grep -rn "LOG(" media/gpu/vaapi/test | grep -v "VLOG" | grep -v "ERROR"

media/gpu/vaapi/test/decode.cc:175: LOG(INFO) << "AMD driver detected, forcing vaGetImage";

media/gpu/vaapi/test/decode.cc:295: LOG(INFO) << "End of stream.";

media/gpu/vaapi/test/decode.cc:318: LOG(INFO) << "Done reading.";

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_dpb.cc:40: LOG(INFO) << "Adding PicNum: " << pic->pic_order_cnt_val_

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_decoder.cc:344: LOG(INFO) << "Codec profile: " << GetProfileName(new_profile)

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_decoder.cc:890: LOG(INFO) << "Outputting frame poc: "

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_vaapi_wrapper.cc:524: LOG(INFO) << "Data pointer is null.";

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_vaapi_wrapper.cc:528: LOG(INFO) << "Submitting Buffer:(size=" << size << ")";

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_vaapi_wrapper.cc:558: LOG(INFO) << "Pending VA bufs to commit: " << pending_buffers_.size();

media/gpu/vaapi/test/h265_vaapi_wrapper.cc:559: LOG(INFO) << "Target VA surface " << va_surface_id;



Incidentally this only affects HEVC code, all other codecs use DVLOG()

already. Note that LOG(ERROR)s are left untouched since we're very

interested in those.



[1] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/main/media/README.md#dvlog



Bug: b:290212133

Change-Id: I4b5290ac751092068bf740d3a4cd83f57f667cbc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4676072

Reviewed-by: Jao-ke Chin-Lee

inactive text colors.

entry.title: Deflake networkState_during_progress.html
entry.content:
The HTML spec specifies that a media element's networkState must be

NETWORK_LOADING when the `progress` event is fired. The `progress`

event is only fired every 350ms.



If the media resource finishes loading before the `progress` event

fires, we still fire the `progress` event once, and immediately fire the

`suspended` event, at which point the networkState will be NETWORK_IDLE.



This CL attempts to deflake networkState_during_progress.html to allow

the NETWORK_IDLE in the `progress` event, if the media resources has

loaded quickly and it immediately followed by a `suspend` event.



Fixed: 1423088

entry.title: Change WebLocalFrameImpl to use Member to hold the current history item.
entry.content:
Previously, the current history item was owned by the WebLocalFrameImpl

as a WebHistoryItem, which is intended to an opaque handle to a

HistoryItem that non-Oilpan aware code can use. Internally, it uses a

Persistent to ensure that the garbage collected HistoryItem remains

live.



However, this means that a garbage collection pass can't clean these

objects up in a single pass once they are no longer unreachable: the

Persistent artificially marks the rest of the object graph as reachable

until the WebLocalFrameImpl is finalized, and only then will subsequent

garbage collection passes reclaim the rest of the objects.



Change WebLocalFrameImpl to use Member to keep the history

item live. Since WebHistoryItem had some functionality on top of

HistoryItem, e.g. specifying the target frame name and PageState

serialization, this functionality has been folded into HistoryItem

itself. WebHistoryItem is now just a thin wrapper around HistoryItem for

the Blink public API.



This also allows some additional simplifications, i.e. the code can just

work with WTF::Vector and std::vector directly rather than going through

WebVector. There may be other simplifications that are possible in the

future, e.g. not going through WebHTTPBody.



One quirk that this CL preserves is that GetReferencedFilePaths() has

two implementations with slightly different behavior: one on HistoryItem

and one on WebHistoryItem. Ever since WebHistoryItem was implemented in

https://crev.com/db4a9b4108635b3678c3f9fd5bdd1f98001db216, it returned

more paths than the HistoryItem-equivalent of GetReferencedFilePaths().

From that CL's description, it looks like it was to make sure that the

browser granted file access to any referenced files in a restored tab.

While it is unclear if this is actually still necessary, it is safer to

preserve the existing behavior for now.



Bug: 1458809

Change-Id: I1225dca87655a052fe349f48691e1843ca391010

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4664558

Reviewed-by: Nate Chapin

entry.title: [anchor-position] Make 'anchor-scroll' internal
entry.content:
See https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/8675 for context.



This patch:



1. Changes the implementation to longer expose `anchor-scroll` as a

CSS property, but use the target of `anchor-default` for scrolling

purposes



2. Coverts tests and UA style to stop using `anchor-scroll`. The usage

is either simply removed if there's already a default anchor, or

changed to use `anchor-default` otherwise. The cases that assume

different `anchor-scroll` and `anchor-default` targets are removed

since they will no longer be a possible.



To minimize diff, this patch focuses on the implementation change.

A follow up patch will convert all in-code documentations and rename

existing classes/functions to stop referring to the functionality as

"anchor-scroll", and hence, stop the naming confusion.

entry.title: [DIPS] Avoid performance overhead in SQL queries
entry.content:
This is to align with https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/sql/README.md#sql-style:

No unnecessary performance overheads. The C++ optimizer doesn't

understand SQL query literals, so the queries end up as written in the

Chrome binary. Extra characters cost binary size, as well as CPU time

(which turns into battery usage) during query parsing.



This CL is no-op.

entry.title: shortcuts: Bug-fix: Edit-button stay showing when not hovering over it
entry.content:
Problem:

* After clicking the edit-button, then go to other row, the previous

edit-button stay showing even though mouse cursor is not hovered

over it.

* Screenshot: http://screen/CEmiU7EFi7Rnmwg

Reason:

* When user clicks the row-container, the row is 'focused', and in css,

we set button-opacity to '1' when row is focused or hovered on it.

Fix:

* We need to differentiate between focus via tab-key and focus via

click. A good solution is to use focus-visible. We only 'focus' the

row when tab on it.



We will 'tab' on the button not the "edit-icon-container", so opacity

and transition property should be move to "edit-button".



Video: http://go/scrcast/NTQwNzA4NDI0Njk5MDg0OHwzZTM4NzVjMy0zMw

entry.title: [anchor-position] Properly implement CSSOM API classes
entry.content:
This patch adds proper implementation of the CSSPositionFallbackRule

and CSSTryRule API as specified [1]:



1. It reimplements `CSSPositionFallbackRule` as a subclass of

`CSSGroupingRule`, and `StyleRulePositionFallback` as a subclass

of `StyleRuleGroup`.



2. It adds some code to `CSSGroupingRule.insertRule()` to make sure

the function only adds `@try` rules into `CSSPositionFallbackRule`.



3. Since `CSSStyleRule.style.setProperty()` can add disallowed

properties into a `@try` block [2], this patch also adds filtering

into the style cascade to make sure when applying the style from

a `@try` rule, only allowed properties' values are applied.



This patch also manually adds the IDL of the APIs into wpt so that we

can add idlharness test without waiting for the IDL auto roller.



[1] https://drafts.csswg.org/css-anchor-position-1/#interfaces

[2] https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9042



Bug: 1309178

Change-Id: Ib7700605a9968a3547fbe99197c882e8aa6caaea

entry.title: WebUI: Simplify the names/classes of bookmarks tests.
entry.content:
Now that bookmarks_browsertest.cc is no longer auto-generated by

js2gtest, a simpler pattern can be used that does not require each test

case to use a different C++ class name.



Example renames:

- BookmarksActionsTest.All -> BookmarksTest.Actions

- BookmarksAppTest.All -> BookmarksTest.App

- BookmarksCommandManagerTest.All -> BookmarksTest.CommandManager

- BookmarksFolderNodeFocusTest.All -> BookmarksFocusTest.FolderNode



Where the somewhat meaningless "*.All" naming pattern is now unnecessary. This also makes it a bit easier to run all such tests, for

example by passing `--gtest_filter=BookmarksTest.*` instead of

`--gtest_filter=Bookmarks*Test.All` previously.

entry.title: Add `clone` to DocumentPartRoot
entry.content:
You can now clone a DocumentPartRoot, and it will a) clone the

underlying document or document_fragment, b) clone all contained `Part`

references from the original to the clone, and c) return you the new

DocumentPartRoot. To allow access to the underlying cloned Node tree, I

also added a DocumentPartRoot.root, which returns the owning Document

or DocumentFragment.



So:

const root = document.getPartRoot();

{ ... add NodePart's and ChildNodePart's to root ... }

const clonedPartRoot = root.clone();

const clonedDocument = clonedPartRoot.root;



To make this work, during cloning (via partRoot.clone), references

are kept in NodeCloningData that point from cloned Nodes to their

clones, and from cloned PartRoots to their clones. Also, a "queue"

of to-be-cloned Parts, keyed by the PartRoot they're waiting for,

is used to handle the common case that the PartRoot for one part

might not be cloned before a Part that refers to it. An example is:















Assume there is a ChildNodePart with previous_sibling/next_sibling,

and a NodePart pointing to middle which has ChildNodePart as its

PartRoot. During the clone of this tree, the ChildNodePart can only

be cloned once parent, previous_sibling, and next_sibling have all

been cloned. However, middle (and its NodePart) will get reached by

the clone operation before next_sibling. So NodePart here needs to

be queued and retried once ChildNodePart is cloned.



Bug: 1453291

Change-Id: I4a85c3ee02547627bcf73ed610310c742238f12c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4671112

Auto-Submit: Mason Freed

Reviewed-by: David Baron

Commit-Queue: David Baron

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1168260}

entry.title: Add functionality to package and sign offline metainstallers in sign.py
entry.content:
This CL enhances the `sign.py` utility to allow packaging and signing an

offline metainstaller by specifying the `--appid`, `--installer_path`

and `--manifest_path` arguments.



For example, to package and sign an offline Chrome metainstaller:



```

python3 sign.py --in_file UpdaterSetup.exe --out_file ChromeSetup.exe

--appid {8A69D345-D564-463c-AFF1-A69D9E530F96}

--installer_path path/to/110.0.5478.0_chrome_installer.exe

--manifest_path path/to/OfflineManifest.gup

```

entry.content:
This CL updates the lacros_sdk_version. This cl only affect

Lacros on-device config builders like lacros-amd64-general-rel,

or ash-chrome builders.



This cl will certainly NOT affect linux-lacros builders

(linux-lacros-tester-rel, linux-lacros-rel, etc) or any

other platforms.



In case the generated cl has issues, please file a bug

to OS>LaCrOS, and CC svenzheng@chromium.org.

entry.title: Migrate Read Anything pref string constants to inline constexpr.
entry.content:
This is a set of changes to migrate various pref string constants to be

defined using inline constexpr. The end goal here is to unblock

migration of the syncable pref allowlist to a compile time FixedFlatMap

rather than building the allowlist dynamically at run time.



Bug: 1459785

entry.title: [TLSAA] Fix up histogram definition and buckets
entry.content:
The existing enum defined a number of buckets that were never used

(and have never been used), so they can be commented-out (following

the guidance at

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/tools/metrics/histograms/README.md#usage).



This CL also:

* Adds a missing doc comment;

* Renames the enum to match what it actually is;

* Updates the histogram to refer to the correct enum;

* Removes some unused includes.
